revised_title: Anatomical Study of the Blood-Vessels in Mustelus Antarcticus
tldr: This study examines the blood vessels of Mustelus antarcticus, providing a detailed account of the arteries and veins in a typical selachian vertebrate. The research aims to clarify and expand upon existing knowledge of the vascular system in fish, with a focus on the renal-portal system and the development of veins.
